content:
MobileListItemCollection Class

Definition

Represents a collection of MobileListItem objects, and is used to hold the items of a List control and a SelectionList control. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
public class MobileListItemCollection : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ArrayListCollectionBase, System.Web.UI.IStateManager
Inheritance
Object
System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ArrayListCollectionBase
MobileListItemCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()
CopyTo(Array,Int32)
Count
GetEnumerator()
IsReadOnly
IsSynchronized
Items
SyncRoot

Remarks

Accessing the Items property of a List control or the Items property of a SelectionList control retrieves a MobileListItemCollection object. You can add or remove items from the collection at run time.

A MobileListItemCollection object inherits from the ICollection interface.

Constructors

MobileListItemCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the MobileListItemCollection class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public MobileListItemCollection ();

MobileListItemCollection(ArrayList)

Initializes a new instance of the MobileListItemCollection class using the provided array. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public MobileListItemCollection (System.Collections.ArrayList items);
items
ArrayList

An array that contains a list of MobileListItem objects.

Remarks

You can use this version of the constructor syntax to populate the new object with the MobileListItemCollection objects contained in the items parameter.

Properties

IsTrackingViewState

Gets a value indicating whether the collection is tracking changes to view state. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected bool IsTrackingViewState { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if tracking view state changes; otherwise, false.

Item(Int32)

Gets a MobileListItem item in the collection by index. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem this[int index] { get; }
index
Int32

The index of the item to retrieve.

Value
MobileListItem

The MobileListItem item at the specified index.

Methods

Add(String)

Adds an item to the end of a collection with the provided string as the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text* property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void Add (string item);
item
String

The item to add to the end of the collection.

Remarks

Creates a new list item with the specified text and then adds it to the end of the collection.

Add(MobileListItem)

Adds an item to the end of a collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void Add (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem item);
item
MobileListItem

The item to add to the end of the collection.

Remarks

Depending on the syntax used, the Add method either adds the specified item to the end of the collection, or constructs a new list item with the specified text and then adds it to the end of the collection.

Clear()

Clears the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void Clear ();

Remarks

This method is not available in the read-only IObjectListFieldCollection interface.

You can use the Clear method for all the classes where this method applies. For example, the Clear method for a StyleSheet collection clears all the styles in the collection; or for the DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection, it clears all the choices in the collection.

Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.

Contains(MobileListItem)

Gets a value indicating whether the given item is contained in the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public bool Contains (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem item);
item
MobileListItem

The item to search for.

Returns
Boolean

true if the given item is contained in the collection; otherwise, false.

GetAll()

Gets the items in the specified collection as a single array of MobileListItem objects. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem[] GetAll ();
Returns
MobileListItem[]

An array of the items in the specified collection.

IndexOf(MobileListItem)

Gets the index of the specified item in a MobileListItemCollection object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public int IndexOf (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem item);
item
MobileListItem

An item to search for in the collection.

Returns
Int32

The index of the specified item in the collection.

Remarks

Gets the index of the specified item as an integer. If the specified item is not in the collection, the IndexOf method returns -1.

Insert(Int32,String)

Adds an item to the specified location in the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void Insert (int index, string item);
index
Int32

The index.

item
String

The item to be inserted into the list.

Remarks

The index value must be between 0 and the size of the collection. If index is the size of the collection, item is added to the end of the collection. This overload first creates a new MobileListItem object with the given string, and inserts this item.

Insert(Int32,MobileListItem)

Adds an item to the specified location in the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void Insert (int index, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem item);
index
Int32

The index.

item
MobileListItem

The item to be inserted into the list.

Remarks

The index value must be between 0 and the size of the collection. If index is the size of the collection, item is added to the end of the collection.

LoadViewState(Object)

Loads the collection's previously saved view state. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected void LoadViewState (object state);
state
Object

The object containing the view-state information to be loaded.

Remove(String)

Removes the item with the specified value. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void Remove (string item);
item
String

The value of the item to remove. The first item that matches this value in the collection is removed.

Remove(MobileListItem)

Removes the item with the specified value. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void Remove (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem item);
item
MobileListItem

The value of the item to remove. The first item that matches this value in the collection is removed.

RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the item at the specified index. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The index number of the item to remove.

SaveViewState()

Saves the changes to a server control's view state to a Object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected object SaveViewState ();
Returns
Object

A Object that contains the view-state information.

SetAll(MobileListItem[])

Sets the array of MobileListItem objects as the MobileListItemCollection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void SetAll (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem[] value);
value
MobileListItem[]

The MobileListItem array.

TrackViewState()

Instructs the collection to track changes to its view state. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected void TrackViewState ();

Remarks

After this method has been called, the IsTrackingViewState property will return true. Also, the IsTrackingViewState property of the IStateManager objects in the MobileListItemCollection will be set to true.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

bool System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if the MobileListItem object is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the MobileListItemCollection instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.

IStateManager.LoadViewState(Object)

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IStateManager.LoadViewState*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

void IStateManager.LoadViewState (object state);
state
Object

The object containing the view state information to be loaded.

Exceptions
Exception

the view state data has been modified or corrupted.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the MobileListItemCollection instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.

IStateManager.SaveViewState()

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

object IStateManager.SaveViewState ();
Returns
Object

The view-state changes for the control.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the MobileListItemCollection instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.

IStateManager.TrackViewState()

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

void IStateManager.TrackViewState ();

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the MobileListItemCollection instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.
